title: Best Natural Remedies To Support Gout Treatment
author: Heather Hanks
description: Gout treatment should include a variety of pain management techniques, including herbal remedies, changing your diet, and gentle exercise.

However, these natural gout treatment options will help you alleviate pain, swelling, and stiffness. Gout [Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM)](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/traditional-chinese-medicine/) provides several treatment options for gout. These natural therapies can be done right at home and provide relief from pain, swelling, and inflammation. Read on to learn more about gout treatment options that can help manage the condition when nothing else has worked. How To Tell If You Need Gout Treatment Gout is a type of arthritis that causes sudden, severe joint pain. It mostly attacks the big toe, though the pain can occur in the [foot](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/general-health/bone-muscle-health/diabetic-foot-ulcer/), ankle, knee, wrist, elbow, and finger joints. You will know it's gout when the skin on the affected areas turns hot, swollen, and red. [Gout](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/weight-and-fitness/diet-and-nutrition/gout-diet/) can happen to anyone. The primary cause is excessive uric acid in the body, a chemical compound in some foods we eat. When you consume too much food high in purine, it forms uric acid crystals around the joints, fluids, and tissues. This causes the joints to swell up and become inflamed, causing pain. There are several risk factors for gout: - Being male - Being in [menopause](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/pregnancy-and-childrens-health/fertility-and-pregnancy/signs-of-early-menopause/) - Suffering from diseases like [congestive heart failure](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/general-health/cardiovascular-health/congestive-heart-failure/), [hypertension](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/general-health/cardiovascular-health/secondary-hypertension/), insulin resistance, metabolic syndrome, [diabetes](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/general-health/energy-and-immunity/type-2-diabetes-diet/), and poor kidney function - Being obese - Consuming certain medications - Drinking [alcohol](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/mental-health/mental-focus/alcohol-abuse/), especially beer - Consuming foods or beverages high in fructose or [sugar](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/pregnancy-and-childrens-health/childrens-health/refined-sugar/) - Having a diet high in purines (red meat, organ meat, anchovies, sardines, mussels, scallops, trout, and tuna). Purines would be broken down into uric acid by the body. - A family history of gout Are There Ways To Prevent Gout? When gout flares up, the pain can last days or weeks before it improves. There is no permanent cure for this condition. Hence, gout can come back, and the cycle of pain will repeat. It may take days, months or years, but gout might reappear. Preventing it from happening altogether is the most effective way to save yourself from the pain. - Maintaining a [healthy weight](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/weight-and-fitness/weight-management/maintaining-healthy-weight/) - Limiting your intake of purine-rich and sugary foods - Restricting your alcohol intake - Staying hydrated - Exercising regularly without putting pressure on the joints - Not [smoking](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/general-health/respiratory-health/quit-smoking/) We can also prevent gout by taking medication to lower uric acid levels, such as allopurinol, febuxostat, or colchicine. Treating underlying diseases such as diabetes, obesity, and thyroid disease, will also help to avoid gout. Western Medicine Gout Treatment To this date, there is no cure for gout. As soon as you feel the pain, you should seek gout treatment immediately to prevent joint damage. Gout can also develop into a more serious problem known as chronic gout, which may affect the kidneys and cause [kidney failure](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/general-health/energy-and-immunity/kidney-function/). Various choices of treatments are available to manage the pain: - Ibuprofen or, in more severe cases, steroids - Rest and raise the limb - Apply an ice pack to the affected joint and keep it away from sheets or blankets when sleeping at night Natural Gout Treatment Options Besides the three traditional treatments listed above, alternative ways exist to relieve the symptoms. Naturopathy Many patients have been looking toward naturopathy to treat their gout. Like Western medicine, it agrees that lifestyle and dietary changes can help treat the condition. Avoid purine-rich foods such as animal organs (liver, kidney, sweetbreads), certain seafood (anchovies), legumes such as beans, especially soybeans, and vegetables like [mushrooms](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/natural-products/supplements/mushroom-coffee/) "Patients should exercise frequently," advises TCM Physician Chew Siew Tiang, since obesity, high blood pressure and high cholesterol make one more susceptible to gout. Naturopath Ketki Vinayachandra suggests maintaining sufficient fluid intake, as this keeps urine diluted, promotes urate excretion, and reduces the risk of kidney stones. Naturopathy also recommends specific herbs such as Devil's Claw. A 2021 review of the herb has shown that there may be strong clinical evidence that Devil's Claw is effective. It is recommended you consult a naturopath before taking the herb to determine the right dosage for your condition. Traditional Chinese Medicine Gout is the result of internal and external factors such as Wind, Dampness, Heat and Cold. These four are considered pathogens and when mixed, they affect qi flow and blood in the body's meridians. When flow is disrupted, it results in pain and gout. In TCM, gout treatment includes herbal remedies and changes in diet and lifestyle. The goal is first to balance out the elements of the body. When the body is in harmony, gout can be easily managed. Before you try any TCM gout treatment, it is important to visit a licensed physician so they can recommend suitable treatment. TCM would recomme - Psyllium seed (Che Qian Zi): A 2018 study discovered that pysllium seed is effective because it contains xanthine oxidase (XOD) inhibitors to reduce uric acid. - Lycopodium (Shi Song): Following a 2022 study on the herb's effects on birds, lycopodium has been considered a treatment option for joint arthritis. - Achyranthes root (Niu Xi): A 2012 study published in Strait Pharmaceutical Journal has stated that achyranthes root can promote the excretion of uric acid, which might make it a good treatment for gout. TCM also believes that y (Da Mai) and green beans (Lu Dou). Try to stay warm and dry hands and feet after washing to prevent Wind and Dampness. Finally, you can try taking supplements that disperse the impacts of outside pathogens. According to one study, [Red Korean ginseng](https://www.euyansang.com/en_US/supplements-health/health-korean-ginseng-essence-G4526.html) can help treat [Lingzhi](https://www.euyansang.com/en_US/supplements/immunity-boosters/lingzhi-cracked-spores-plus-G8885015618233.html) and [Cordyceps](https://www.euyansang.com/en_US/herbs-cordyceps/cordyceps-capsules-60s-G8885015618004.html) mushrooms can help reduce gout pain by regulating inflammation levels and reducing uric acid, respectively. Use Multiple Approaches To Manage Gout You don't have to deal with the pain alone. Be mindful of your diet and cultivate a positive attitude, as stress can trigger a gout attack. Remember, conventional or alternative gout treatment must be taken after a careful diagnosis. Contact your doctor or physician to get the right treatment for you.
